structure.unit: Sec. 8-2009. - NEW OR REPLACEMENT WATER AND SEWER SYSTEMS TO BE FLOOD-RESISTANT.

law.catch_line: NEW OR REPLACEMENT WATER AND SEWER SYSTEMS TO BE FLOOD-RESISTANT.

text.section: Any and all new or replacement water supply systems and sanitary sewage systems within floodprone areas shall be designed and constructed to minimize and eliminate infiltration of floodwaters into such systems and to minimize and eliminate discharges from such systems into floodwaters.
Any and all on-site new waste disposal systems within floodprone areas shall be located, designed and constructed so as to avoid impairment of them or contamination from them during flooding.

Any venting of any sanitary sewer system and nonwatertight manholes shall be constructed to a height at least one (1) foot above the regulatory flood protection elevation provided nothing herein shall prevent the construction of watertight manholes below the regulatory flood protection elevation. (Code 1959 , §23-35; Ord. No. 1978-872-TC-88, §§16—19, 8-15-78)
